jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)burst out or cause to burst out laughing

lj.lj_ly: Jo could imitate anybody and always made him crease up.
lj.lj_ls: 乔能模仿任何人并总能逗得他大笑。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: probably a variant of crest

entry.def: Creases are lines that are made in cloth or paper when it is crushed or folded.

example.ex: She stood up, frowning at the creases in her silk dress...
example.tran: 她站起身来，看到丝裙上的褶痕皱起了眉头。

example.ex: Papa flattened the creases of the map with his broad hands.
example.tran: 爸爸用他的一双大手捋平了地图上的折痕。

entry.def: If cloth or paper creases or if you crease it, lines form in it when it is crushed or folded.

example.ex: Most outfits crease a bit when you are travelling...
example.tran: 旅行时大多数服装都会略微起褶。

example.ex: Liz sat down on the bed, lowering herself carefully so as not to crease her skirt.
example.tran: 莉兹小心翼翼地坐在床上，生怕把裙子弄皱。

entry.tran: (皮肤因为皱眉或微笑而)起皱纹;使(皮肤)起皱纹
entry.def: If your face creases or if an expression creases it, lines appear on it because you are frowning or smiling.

example.ex: His ruddy face still routinely creases with mirth...
example.tran: 他红润的脸庞仍旧时常笑得堆起褶子。

example.ex: For just the second time a look of emotion creases his face.
example.tran: 他的脸上，第二次流露出了感情。

entry.def: Creases in someone's skin are lines which form where their skin folds when they move.

example.ex: ...the tiny creases at the corners of his eyes...
When Crevecoeur smiled, the creases in his face deepened.
example.tran: 克雷弗克一笑，脸上的皱纹就加深了。

entry.tran: (板球场上击球手的)位置线，击球线
entry.def: In cricket, the crease is a line on the playing surface where the batsman stands.

example.ex: Haynes was still at the crease, unbeaten on 84.
example.tran: 海恩斯还在击球线上，他已经得了84分了。

means.word_mean: 1. an angular or rounded shape made by folding;
2. a slight depression in the smoothness of a surface;
3. a Malayan dagger with a wavy blade
1. make wrinkles or creases into a smooth surface;
4. become wrinkled or crumpled or creased;

means.word_mean: (衣服、纸张等的)折缝, 折痕

sentences.en: He had razor-sharp creases in his trousers.

jushi.english: His forehead creased in a frown.
Pack the clothes carefully so that you don't crease them.
jushi.chinese: 把衣服细心装好,免得弄皱了。
